name: Boston Marriott Quincy

reviews.text: Up to the Marriott standard, and probably a great location for business meetings, as prices are lower than in-town locations, yet you are close to the city for night life. Well done all around and very reasonably priced. Located on a high bluff just south of Quincy with a commanding view of the countryside. Rooms were quiet, well appointed, and clean.
reviews.title: Fine hotel, close to and south of Boston

reviews.text: Recently I was in Boston for two nights with my family. I had traveled there with my wife to pick up our daughter who was in the area for a summer program. We intended to travel around the area to see some colleges and then grab some fresh lobster just over the border in Maine. We did not want to stay in the city as our flight left from Providence and the location of this hotel would shave at least 20 minutes off of our trip to the Providence airport. The Marriott was a great alternative to a City Hotel. It was a modern clean hotel off of the interstate, albeit in an office park in the not so exciting city of Quincy. Nevertheless, we just needed a clean place to sleep that had easy access to the highways. The Quincy Marriott was the perfect answer. Of course, for the most part, you will need a car unless you want to get a ride to the nearby T Station which I probably would not recommend using at night. Parking was free and the buffet breakfast was fresh and reasonably priced assuming it is not included in your room rate. It took us about 15-20 minutes to get into the city.
reviews.title: Great Alternative to City Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed over July 4th weekend at Boston Quincy Marriott. The hotel was just off the highway, top of a hill. There is shuttle to T stop and parking is free, so you can save $30 staying here then in Boston. The room is great. Very clean. There is nice restaurant in lobby. Our meal was wonderful, $16.95 for all you can eat prime rib dinner. Breakfast buffet was excellent also.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel close to Boston

reviews.text: we chanced upon this Marriott and even though it is a little outside Boston - dont be put off by the location, they run a shuttle to and fro the T station (Boston trains) and even to the airport and the local shopping Mall. Rock up rates were reasonable and the room and bathroom were excellent, two queen beds, free wireless internet in the lobby, exceptionally helpful staff and the free shuttle a great bonus. We had the BEST prime rib meal (all you can eat if you are really hungry) in the hotel restaurant - again great service and attentive staff. Can also recommend the buffet breakfast ($14.95 +). The hotel is obviously popular and can get busy in the lobby but check in was a breeze as was check out. Free parking but no little in room fridge.
reviews.title: Great service at a classy Hotel -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although this hotel was easy to get to, very clean, had free parking and friendly and helpful staff, it was average (at best!) for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Average stay at an average hotel...

reviews.text: I like everything about this hotel - a nice Marriott like, great service, room and excellent gym. Good restaurants on location, but pricey. If you have a car then it's an ideal hotel to stay for biz and family..
reviews.title: Nice Hotel .. but problem if you are wihtout a Car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But wouldn't recommend for a traveller who doesn't have a car - as the location is bit off, and the shuttle service is not all that quick/convenient. I consult for a Multi-national client in this area and this happens to be on recommended list, so stay there for my business trips. On the last trip, I had to spend quite some on my own Cab fares to get to/from work in time as the shuttle was overbooked to capacity (and they did charge extra for shuttle as well), not a pleasant experience !
reviews.title: Comfortable and easy

reviews.text: We checked into the Marriott quincy with out any hassle. They gave us a nice room overlooking the quarry. The restaurant was ok. The pool was nice.
reviews.title: Quiet except in the weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was everything we wanted for an overnight stay
reviews.title: A Wonderful Anniversary
Good place to stay for Boston
reviews.text: All ´n all a good hotel, close to boston and well communicated by highway and subway. Food is overpriced but Boston and Quincy restaurants are close by. The hotel tends to be very crowded in the weekends due to the wedding parties that take place here. So breakfast at Saturdays and Sundays are very busy as well as people having their private afterparties after the wedding party. Dont stay close to the elevators since the bell sound of arriving elevators can get annoying. The gym is great
Near interstate and by South Shore Mall about a 15 min drive to the airport and the downtown Boston. Very comfortable beds and had a great view of the city!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: My family stayed here 2 nights, and we had a fantastic time! The staff was extremely courteous and helpful- they went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The rooms were immaculate and had a terrific view. We ate at the restaurant, and the food was really delicious, especially the pumpkin cheesecake. The health club (which was necessary to work off the yummy meals) was excellent, with top-of-the-line equipment, an indoor pool, jacuzzi and sauna, a welcome respite on a chilly autumn day. The lady at the health club even gave my daughter toys for the pool! The hotel is 20 minutes' drive from Boston, and 40 minutes' drive to Plymouth, making it a centrally-located option for touring the many historic areas in Eastern Massachusetts. The Adams homestead Peacefield is also right in town. We had a wonderful time and are planning to return.
reviews.title: No Quibbles in Quincy- A Wonderful Place to Stay!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel at least six times a year for the past three years. I stay there because it is “the only game” in town. I have never bothered to comment on this venue because it is the hospitality equivalent of plain vanilla. The facility is boilerplate Marriott with one very notable exception, service. The staff’s attitude is best characterized as someplace between indifferent and loathsome. They equate exceptional service with showing up! The hotel appears to cater to groups, especially on the weekends. The staff assumes the group rate to be exclusive of service. In the interest of impartiality, regular paying guests are treated the same.
reviews.title: Marriott sign on building, service inside A.W.O. L.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in an isolated location on a hill above the outskirts of Quincy; therefore, a car is required. There is ample parking space, both outdoors and indoors. There is a $12.95 per diem charge for internet service. This never ceases to amaze me given the fact that Marriott’s lower price brands provide internet service as a complimentary amenity. I relish the moment when an acceptable alternative opens.
reviews.title: Hard to Find Fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flawless stay. Room available on-time. Reception staff courteous, efficient, and fast. Room was immaculately clean, everything functioned as it should. Restaurant wait staff attentive and friendly. Quality of food on breakfast buffet well above average. Despite there being a high level of occupancy and a weekend, the room and halls were quiet, perhaps the result of the signs posted stating the hotel policy on respecting "quiet times."
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We are live locally and so we often stay a few night throught the winter at the Marriott or the Sheraton in Braintree. This past Saturday night stay was horrible. The restaraunt "Kilroy's" had only a few tables filled @ 6:30 pm yet the wait for the server to come over(20 mins) and for our food to finally arrive, was lengthy. There was only one waitress, albeit she was very polite and good at her job, but then the tables filled up so quickly, she just couldn't handle it. I ordered the lobster roll and it was the most tasteless one I've ever had, it was watery and roll was stale. My daughter had a magherita panini and my son had buffalo wings which tasted like that had been cooked twice; needless to say we left most of our food at the table and the bill was $62. We finally escaped at 8:30 pm.
reviews.title: If You are interested in using the Pool, call the HOTEL first!!!!

reviews.text: The teens were excited to spend the rest of the time lounging in the pool and jacuzzi., since that was the purpose of our trip down the street! Unfortunately, the Hotel had deciced to close it @ 9 instead of the usual 11 pm. What a shock! I called "at Your Service" and told them of my disappointment and problem and they said the manager would call me back.. About 9;45 pm Eric called me and I explained that I lived locally and that the whole purpose was to be able to enjoy the pool area. He apologized and said something about maintenance being done, and that turned out to be a farce because we checked it out and no one was working down there. He said if I wanted, I could "leave" and wouldn't be charged for the room, and I said that I really didn't want to pack up and go out in the cold so I asked for the Concierage Room to be opened so the kids could have separate TVs, he said he couldn't do that. He finally offered me an additional room so that the kids could use the TV. He argued that the kids could use the pool the next day and I explained that my daughter had to be at work @ 7 am.
reviews.title: Great Property just outside Boston!

reviews.text: When I checked out they asked me how my stay was and I told them I was extremely disappointed, and they offered to take 20% off my rate. I wasn't happy with that and so I asked them to invite me back, and they said they couldn't do that. I've stayed at Marriott Hotels since I was kid and even met Bill Marriott last year in San Juan. This kind of service isn't typical of the brand, so think twice before you stay here.
reviews.title: Definition of a full service hotel, great atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In hindsight, we could've just stayed home and saved $150. What a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!
reviews.title: Super nice.

reviews.text: If you're a business traveler heading to Boston, especially South of the city, you should certainly consider staying at the Boston Marriott Quincy. I've stayed here weekly for about 7 months on a previous project, left the area for about 6 months, and now I'm back for another project and it's as if I never left. First day back I got a personal greeting from Melissa who had my check-in ready. A personal greeting after being gone 6 months! That's great service. It doesn't stop there. The entire hotel staff is very friendly, going out of their way to help with any of your needs. Janice and Rachel in the Concierge Room ensure a good breakfast and after-dinner reception. I frequent the restaurant where the service level continues. Ask for Yanni, Susan or Kristen at the bar. David, the manager, has done a great job with the atmosphere, decor and fitness center.
reviews.title: Great Rate, Great Stay

description: Located in Quincy, MA, this hotel offers access to Boston, Plymouth and Cape Cod. Features 464 hotel rooms, a pool and health club, and on-site restaurants including Kilroy's Irish Pub and Hancock's Restaurant.
